Events and the Creative and Cultural Industries

This course offers a comprehensive exploration of the role and impact of events within the Creative and Cultural Industries (CCI). It enhances the students’ ability to engage in discourse about the relationship between events and the arts; and be effective practitioners of events management in an arts and creative industry context. By examining relevant theories, concepts, and real-world case studies in various facets of the arts, students will be equipped to understand and challenge key theoretical debates and practices in the dynamic field of events as it intersects with the arts.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Understand the significance of events within the creative and cultural industries.

+  Engage with events as cultural products.

+  Understand theoretical approaches to marketing and consumption practices and the role of events in a range of CCI sectors including film, fine art, music, and heritage.

+  Understand and apply theoretical concepts to practical event planning and management scenarios within the CCI.
